metadata.title: CVE-2020-27755 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
in SetImageExtent() of /MagickCore/image.c, an incorrect image depth sizecan cause a memory leak because the code which checks for the proper imagedepth size does not reset the size in the event there is an invalid size.The patch resets the depth to a proper size before throwing an exception.The memory leak can be triggered by a crafted input file that is processedby ImageMagick and could cause an impact to application reliability, suchas denial of service. This flaw affects ImageMagick versions prior to7.0.9-0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27755` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

imagemagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
imagemagick-6.q16 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
imagemagick-common - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libimage-magick-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libimage-magick-q16-perl - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagick++-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagick++-6.q16-5v5 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickcore-6-arch-config - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickcore-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickcore-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickcore-6.q16-2-extra - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickwand-6-headers - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
libmagickwand-6.q16-2 - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
perlmagick - 8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '8:6.8.9.9-7ubuntu5.16+esm11').
